How to resotre database in postgresql

date: Sep 10, 2015 category: how-to tags: postgresql

in ubuntu:

Installation

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install postgresql postgresql-contrib

Login and change password

huang$ sudo su
root@t400:~# 
root@t400:~# su - postgres
No protocol specified
xrdb: Resource temporarily unavailable
xrdb: Can't open display ':0.0'
postgres@t400:~$ 
postgres@t400:~$ psql
postgres=#
postgres=# \password postgres
Enter new password: 
Enter it again:

restore

postgres@t400:~$ createdb PGCloudmigration
postgres@t400:~$ psql PGCloudmigration < /home/huang/dev/da/code/Nefolog/sql/PGCloudmigrationDB.bak

test redcarpet

public class Test {
    private int i = 0;
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("i");
    }
}

sudo u
